lead_paragraph: SULZBERGER--Jean, Author and Editor, 94, died peacefully on Saturday at her apartment in Manhattan. She lived a full and varied life as a journalist, author and editor. Her book "Search: Journey on the Inner Path" published in 1979, reflected her lifelong interest in spirituality, mysticism and world religions. For many years Jean worked at Time, Inc., including stints as the magazine's religion correspondent and editor. She was active in the Gurdjieff Foundation in New York and was involved with the magazine Parabola for decades. Jean Sulzberger was the oldest child of David H. and Louise B. Sulzberger. She was born in 1922 in New York and lived in Manhattan all her life. She traveled extensively around the world including annual solo trips to Jerusalem until she was in her late 80s. Jean is survived by her sister Ann S. Sand, by seven nieces and nephews, fifteen great-nieces and great-nephews and two great-great nieces. Her sister Ellen S. Straus died in 1995. Services will be private. A memorial will be held on Saturday, February 27th. Memorial gifts may be made to Parabola, 20 West 20th Street, New York, NY 10011. 1/3
